abstract: The regulations require cable TV companies to make programming available on equal terms to rival TV providers.
snippet: The regulations require cable TV companies to make programming available on equal terms to rival TV providers.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A United States appeals court on Friday upheld a Federal Communications Commission rule that forbids cable companies that also own programming channels from refusing to allow competitors to also offer those channels.

headline.main: Appeals Court Upholds Access Rules for Cable TV
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Upholds Access Rules for Cable TV
